Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 43rd overall pick, by Atlanta in 1966...
Released by Atlanta on 3/2/1966...
Signed as a free agent by San Francisco on 3/2/1966 to a minor league deal...
Injured on 6/12/1970 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 6/29/1970 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 4 days...
Injured on 9/1/1970 with a Pulled Bicep Muscle, out for 5-6 weeks...
Had first career hit on 4/4/1971, off Tom Hilgendorf (STL)...
Earned first career win on 4/4/1971...
Injured on 7/27/1973 with a Sore Shoulder, out for one week...
Won World Series with San Francisco in 1973...
Pitched NO-HITTER against Atlanta on 5/1/1975, striking out 9...
Injured on 5/6/1975 with a Torn Tricep Muscle, out for 7 weeks...
Injured on 6/26/1975 with a Tight Shoulder, out for one week...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/28/1975, winning 2 games with a 2.16 ERA...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/25/1976, winning 2 games with a 2.81 ERA...
Struck out 15 batters against Philadelphia on 4/27/1978...
Struck out 15 batters against New York (N) on 6/19/1978...
Struck out 15 batters against Atlanta on 6/23/1978...
